com.defano.jsegue

Class AnimatedSegue

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.defano.jsegue.AnimatedSegue
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    AbstractShrinkEffect, AbstractZoomEffect, BarnDoorCloseEffect, BarnDoorOpenEffect, BlindsEffect, CheckerboardEffect, DissolveEffect, PlainEffect, ScrollDownEffect, ScrollLeftEffect, ScrollRightEffect, ScrollUpEffect, StretchFromBottomEffect, StretchFromCenterEffect, StretchFromTopEffect, WipeDownEffect, WipeLeftEffect, WipeRightEffect, WipeUpEffect

    public abstract class AnimatedSegue
extends Object
    Abstract base class representing an animated image segue.

    • Method Detail

      • render

        public abstract BufferedImage render(BufferedImage src,
                                     BufferedImage dst,
                                     float progress)
        Renders a frame in the segue animation. The animator will invoke this method repeatedly at a frequency and count determined by FPS and duration. Note that every animation sequence starts with a call to this method using progress = 0.0f and ends with a call using progress = 1.0f. Thus, irrespective of FPS or duration, every animation will always have at least two frames.
        Parameters:
        src - The source image; guaranteed to be the same dimensions as dst.
        dst - The destination image; guaranteed to be the same dimensions as src.
        progress - A value between 0.0 and 1.0 (inclusive) representing the a location in the segue sequence the frame should be drawn.
        Returns:
        A BufferedImage representing the frame at this location in the sequence; should be the same dimensions as src/dst.

      • start

        public void start()
        Begin animating this segue using the provided source and destination images; max frames per second, and alpha isOverlay mode.

      • stop

        public void stop()
        Stops the running animation; has no effect if there is no active animation.

      • addCompletionObserver

        public void addCompletionObserver(SegueCompletionObserver observer)
        Adds an observer of animation completion events (fires each time this segue completes its animation sequence).
        Parameters:
        observer - The observer destination be notified on animation completion.

      • addCompletionObservers

        public void addCompletionObservers(Collection<SegueCompletionObserver> observers)

        Parameters:
        observers - The observers destination be added.

      • addAnimationObserver

        public void addAnimationObserver(SegueAnimationObserver observer)
        Adds an observer of animation frame events (fires each time a new frame has been rendered in the animation.)
        Parameters:
        observer - The observer of animation frame events.

        Parameters:
        observers - The observers.

      • removeAnimationObserver

        public boolean removeAnimationObserver(SegueAnimationObserver observer)
        Removes an animation frame observer.
        Parameters:
        observer - The observer destination remove.
        Returns:
        True if the given observer exists in the registered list of observers and was removed; false otherwise.

      • removeCompletionObserver

        Removes an animation completion observer.
        Parameters:
        observer - The observer destination remove.
        Returns:
        True if the given observer exists in the registered list of observers and was removed; false otherwise.

      • getFps

        public int getFps()
        Gets the maximum frames per second this animation will produce.
        Returns:
        The max FPS.

      • setFps

        public void setFps(int fps)
        Sets the maximum number of frames per second this animation will produce. Note that, 1) a start frame and an end frame will always be produced irrespective of maxFps, thus at least two frames will always be produced, and 2) the actual frames per second will be limited to the CPUs ability to render them in time.
        Parameters:
        fps - The maximim number of frames per second (best effort)

      • isOverlay

        public boolean isOverlay()
        Determines if overlay is enabled. In general, when overlay is turned off, the destination image is treated effectively as opaque and its bounds fully obscure the source even if all or a portion of it is translucent. The actual effect this has on animation differs based on the specific renderer.
        Returns:
        True if overlay is enabled; false otherwise.

      • setOverlay

        public void setOverlay(boolean isOverlay)
        Sets whether or not overlay is enabled. See isOverlay() for a description of overlay.
        Parameters:
        isOverlay - Whether overlays should be enabled.
